alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lackawanna and eastern Wyoming Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dalton, or near Waverly, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scranton, Falls, Clarks Summit, Tunkhannock, Clarks Green, Glenburn, Dalton, Factoryville, Nicholson and La Plume. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 194 and near 202. Interstate 476 near 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
